page.title: 05Woolhampton Primary School
page.content: Woolhampton school is on a hill next to a church. We have four classrooms, one dinner and P.E. hall, one kitchen and two offices for the headteacher and the secretary. We have a new library with lots of interesting books which was opened on Tuesday the 18th June 1985 by a school governor, Miss Blythe-Currie who is eighty six. Children start school at five years old and leave primary school at eleven years old and go to secondary school. most children go to Kennet School. we have a needle work teacher called Mrs Weight and she is very kind she makes lots of toys and clothes for herself. Last year a new head teacher come to our school and her name is Mrs Brownjohn. Mrs Whitehead and Mrs Bunce left the school.
